intro: Erigeron annuactis, commonly known as the annual fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron annuactis is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it thrives in sunny conditions.
